Title: Well Received Gift
Body: This was a gift and well received.You must know your WiFi settings before getting started

Title: Works wonders
Body: The speaker is not as good as Alexa tall, but this is fantastic for the price.  Easy to set up.

Title: Like it but I the echo better
Body: Like  it but I the echo better. The dot u have to speak loud to get it to hear / understand you.

Title: Love this device
Body: Love this device. It is right on point and provides me with personalized music request, weather updates, and other fun commands. Love it and highly recommend it as a "must have" device.

Title: Awesome little device, setup was a bit lacking
Body: This is my first Dot and my second Echo device. It took me several hours to get it online. For some reason or another it would not join my wireless network or sync to my amazon account. After resetting the Dot and then reentering my amazon password on my kindle which is where i was doing my configuration from I was able to get it setup. This was a very surprising experience after my original Echo which was so simple and seamless.

Title: lol It is fun to have around
Body: Alexa has become one of the family....lol  It is fun to have around, easy to use for news, podcasts, timers, orders, wikipedia, jokes, audiobooks, alarm clock, music, recipes....on and on.  We coupled it with a Bose speaker and the quality is perfect.

Title: Very disappointed with this product
Body: Spends more time telling me it doesn't understand  my question or can't find the answer. Cortana, Google Assistant, and Siri do more. Very disappointed with this product. Going to give Google home a try I guess.

Title: It works pretty much like the original Echo and the first generation ...
Body: It works pretty much like the original Echo and the first generation Dot.  I have them all over the house now.

Title: Trying Google Home next.
Body: I think we might get the Google too, there is a lot Alexa doesn't know that I know Google will.

Title: I bought it to use mainly with my smart devices and it doesn't work perfect
Body: I bought it to use mainly with my smart devices and it doesn't work perfect. You need to state exactly what you want it to. I have two Caseta Light switches and if I wan't both off you can't just say "Alexa, turn off the lights" I have to turn off both individually. Working with Harmony it has limited features. If I wan't to mute the volume Alex can't do it. The dot is very responsive, just functionality kinda sucks.

Title: Great new member to the Household
Body: After a few weeks she is a part of the household. Very easy to set up and most time the voice recognition is very good though she does at times gets a word totally wrong but retraining puts her back on track. If you are going to position it near a speaker hook up or you will mainly use it for non-music functions the DOT speaker is adequate. Otherwise spend the money on the full Echo, but seriously get one of them.

Title: i like but unfortunately a white echo comes with black accessories
Body: I like the echo dot and the features it comes with. I like that you can use it as a speaker and connect it to spotify. echo understands you fine. it has a lot of additional apps like meditation, 7min workout, etc.I really like.BIG CON: why does a white echo comes with a black charger and black charger cabel. That's is very dissapointing. nowadays it can be expected to come with white accessories.

Title: We live in the future!
Body: Just set this up last night and I already love it. I bought it in order to control various smart appliances I'll be getting for my new house, but even without the smart lights and outlets etc, this thing is pretty cool. I've mostly been using it to play my Prime music library, but I'm sure it will quickly become a staple in my house.I just hope Alexa doesn't become self-aware and decide to take over ;(

Title: A Great Product
Body: So great!! I also convinced my brother to get one - mostly use it to listen to music and control the bedroom lights (via Philips Hue). I live in Dubai, only downside is that I can't set my location to Dubai so timing/weather etc doesn't work for me as well as it should (I have to say "tell me the time in Dubai" rather than just "tell me the time") but isn't a big deal. I would definitely recommend.

Title: I love all the things the Echo can do for me
Body: I love all the things the Echo can do for me, the speaker isn't very loud, but it sounds great.

Title: dumber?
Body: I swear my Alexa has gotten stupider over time.I basically just use her for timers and alarms and music sometimes

Title: Great for elderly parent
Body: Bought this for my 90 year old mother for Xmas and she loves it!  Plays all of her favorite songs, wakes her up in the morning, and tells her all the sports scores!  Easy to hookup to WiFi and virtually hands-free!  I'm getting one for myself!

Title: LOVE!!
Body: LOVE!!!!! When I first seen the box, my first thought before opening it was... Oh, wow this is small, but its very cute... LOVE!!! My 2 daughters where well up passed their bedtime talking to "Alexa" for hours!!!!! This is a great buy!

Title: The beginning of the future.
Body: Blown away but the creative uses I find for this product. Not the best speaker in the world but at this price compared to the Echo you can buy a great bluetooth speaker to pair. I'm excited to see what software updates are added in the future.

Title: Definitely worth it
Body: Gotta love Alexa.  Turn on my lights plays  my music does almost everything except for the dishes

Title: Spawn on Echo!
Body: Love the dot!! Does everything the echo can do, just not as good of a sound system. (speakers)

Title: like "when is the first day of Hanukkah
Body: She still has problems with simple questions...like "when is the first day of Hanukkah?"

Title: TERRIBLE SUPPORT
Body: Amazon support for my many Echo devices has been less than acceptable.  I have successfully asked Alexa to "Play CNN", and it has always done that since I first started using my first Echo.  In the past 12 hours it no longer responds to this command, asking now what I want to hear, specific stories, latest news, etc. it will only play the CNN audio stream by forcing you to go to the Echo app.  I documented the issue in an email to Amazon!  They said I needed to call them directly to work on the problem.  I did, and spent more than 30 useless minutes on the phone with their representative.  At the end of my conversation with their representative she stated that it was CNN that changed the way my Echos respond to the command "Alexa play CNN", and I should contact them.  I would not know where to begin to do this.  Amazon's support regarding my issue, and most likely many other users who regularly listen to the CNN audio stream, via Tunein, was unacceptable.

Title: Better speaker than expected!
Body: What's not to like? So fun and easy and has pretty good sound for a little speaker.  Great for news and sports and music.
I love my echos they are great,such a good little assistant,and game player,use youre Alexa app and enable games,to play.

Title: Creepy but we'll keep her
Body: She's kinda creepy, but we'll keep her. She randomly listens to us (you can tell because she lights up).

Title: Fun gadget
Body: I love this gadget - it's just fun.  Want to know when Tug McGraw died - no need to get up, just ask Alexa.  Want to know the weather, or listen to music, no need to get up, just ask Alexa.  The only reason i gave it a 4 instead of a 5 is because I wish it were connected to the TV (would be great to say, "Alexa, turn on Bosch, season 2".  We have ours connected via Bluetooth to a Bose Soundlink speaker.  Very easy setup.

Title: A fun product, but not life changing.
Body: A fun product, but not life changing.  It's nice to as Alexa what the weather is when I wake up or "play some smooth jazz" while I'm getting dressed.  But I'm not going to just order products out of the blue without seeing what I'm ordering.There's a lot of time that she "doesn't understand what the heck I'm asking about", but I'm assuming the AI will get better the more people use it.

Title: Dragged, kicking & screaming into the ultra modern age we are & lovin it!
Body: Excellent new product, performs almost everything an inanimate object can without moving. The sound quality is great on the full size units and good on the Echo. I carry it into my shop to use because it's sound is better than my old radio. Whether you want music, the time, suggestions for recipes, the days interests or the weather, it will be provided with a minimum of effort. We thoroughly enjoy the technology.

Title: It works great! The BlueTooth is not the best
Body: It works great! The BlueTooth is not the best, you will have to buy the male to male stereo audio to connect it to your speakers, but then you have all Alexa opportunities. We have echo downstairs and the Echo Dot upstairs. LOVE IT!

Title: Skip it. Terrible wifi.
Body: The wifi antenna in this thing is terrible. I can't position it anywhere and get reliable feeds. It cuts out constantly. Without any feedback, just silence theres nothing in the app about signal, there's no way to troubleshoot. Regular echo does not have this issue. Skip this one.

Title: Order 3 and save defective add
Body: Just ordered one Dot reviews seem great I will let you know. Problem with your add says ORDER 3 save $20.00 but when tried ordering 3 I saw no savings. That add should take buyer  right to an order three page with the savings clearly shown.I went back to the for know the other two were for gifts their loss

Title: Great!
Body: I have this in my bedroom, and all the functions are just as good as the full size Echo in the living room. As for music I link it via Bluetooth through my Bose sound link speaker so there is no need for a built in one, and it works great.

Title: They we able to separate my money from my wallet.
Body: Bought it for the wife and after a week she wanted nothing to do with it. Over hyped and over priced. I don't need it because I have Amazon Fire TV and my cable company provides a similar service for no cost. Just another silly techie fad.

Title: My Favorite Amazon Purchase EVER!!!
Body: The Alexa Dot is by far, my favorite purchase EVER from Amazon!  I have been making Amazon purchases for almost ten years now too, and so that just reinforces just how fun and cool this little hockey puck sized device really is!

Title: It's certainly is a good product for the price of $50
Body: It's certainly is a good product for the price of $50.  However it does not compare to the large one.  We use it multiple times a days  so if you cam spare $179.000 I strongly recommend you purchase the larger one.I have both.

Title: We just received this today and we love it. Even my girls can use it
Body: We just received this today and we love it. Even my girls can use it. My husband was fascinated. The best part it that it does what WE need it to. From schedules, to alarms, to allowing my husband to check my heart rate via fitbit. I have a defibrillator and this will give my husband peace of mind. Im giving it 4 stars ONLY cause there should be more it can do but for now it works.

Title: Not secure
Body: Woke up to a strang voice in my kitchen.. the building next door has been connecting to my echo via Bluetooth.Really scary. They were playing music  at full volume through my echo.

Title: Amazon rocks!
Body: Â Definitely worth every penny. I have the Amazon Echo for my home coffee table,, the Amazon Tap for portability, and now the Amazon Dot I just installed in my car (which you have to have wi-fi in for it to work). Skills as to what she can do seems unlimited because they are being added all the time. I bought the Echo for 180, the Tap for 125 and now the Dot for 50. Oh, I have an Amazon Fire also. Love my Amazon products. You will too. If I sound like a salesman, it's because I am, but for a major cable TV/broadband HSD/digital phone company. I was not incentivized to do this review.  Make sure you get Amazon Prime for the maximum benefit! Enjoy!- Markp.s. - For those wishing to install Dot in your wi-fi enabled vehicle, I found you have to power the device by a USB portable charger external battery pack because I get feedback in the cars audio if powered by the vehicles own USB. Also Bluetooth is not supported by a connection that requires a pin, so I am connected for audio using a 3.5 mm to 3.5 mm. It's awesome for music, distance requests, some local business searches, Distance to destination info (it gives you the distance from point A to point B, and then adds, "as the crow flies". I got a kick out of that). Just can't say enough good. I'm addicted to Amazon.

Title: The concept of the echo dot is good, but qualitty of the speaker is poor
Body: The concept of the echo dot is good, but qualitty of the speaker is poor. For better quality sound get the echo.

Title: Life of the party!
Body: Alexa isn't all that bright, or perhaps it is me. I ask her questions that I would like to know the answers for, she says she does not know. Her best quality is her ability to set an alarm to remind me when to go to work.

Title: This by far the best device I've integrated into my life in the past ...
Body: This by far the best device I've integrated into my life in the past 5 years. I use it for everything for turning the lights on/of, to listening to music (the inbuilt speaker is surprisingly good), to playing jeopardy :)

Title: Terrific.
Body: what a wonderful addition .... learn how to do use it for listening to News updates and other things ... but the music selection and speaker is terrific. I expect great things from this cloud-based product.

Title: Alexa Dot 2nd Gen Review
Body: Received my 2nd Gen Dots on Oct 20th while at work and had to wait all day to get home and set them up. I split a 6 pack with my dad and I already owned 2 others(The Original and the 1st Gen Dot) and couldn't wait to set my three 2nd Gen Dots up. I use the Alexa to control the lights and temperature at my house, as well as play music, ask questions, hear news/radio, and any of the apps that I can manage to remember the commands too(like "triggerâ€¦" from IFTTT).Set Up:Set up was easy since I had already setup an account when I setup the other two. After searching and finding the Dots, all I had to do was tell it which WiFi to connect to and rename it to the room/area I was going to put it at.Testing new Feature:After I set all of them up and but while I still had them all in the same room, I ran a test  to see how well the Echos' were at choosing which Echo was closest. Without fail every time that I said a command(from different locations), the closest echo was the only one that responded. All of the others indicated that they heard me, but then ignored me and let the closest one answer. In some tests I was only inches away from all of them and the one that heard me the clearest was the only one that responded.This is awesome! For any one that has had more then one Echo before this one, you know how annoying it was when you would say a command, like "play music by so and so" and every Echo would then start playing a random song from so and so. Before this update I had to change my Echo's summoning word so that they wouldn't always answer at the same time, which annoyed my wife and guests that could never remember which Echo was called "Alexa" and which one was just called "Echo" and for a while I had 3 and I had to call that one "Amazon". So now with this update, all of the Echo's (including the old ones) can now all have the same Summoning word of "Alexa", which is great now that I have 5 Echo's in the house now.With the coverage I now have in the house, I now no longer have any issues with Alexa hearing me. I have yet to connect any of them to external speakers, but I have never had an issue with that before. I will update this review if there are any issues or any questions any one has about it.The Look, the Feel, the Design, all while comparing it to the 1st gen:As for the look. Thatâ€™s really up to you and your needs. I went with the white ones, mainly because I had 2 black ones already, but also I thought the white ones would fit better with my houses colour scheme. Which is more important to my wife, and now that they are here and setup, she agrees that I made the right choice.  The white ones fit in better and in some cases blended in with my house and can go unnoticed until needed.Comparing the 2nd Gen to the 1st Gens. They donâ€™t feel as nice or as solid as the 1st Gen Dots, but then they do come $50 cheaper then that model and yet do everything just as well or better. Donâ€™t get me wrong, I donâ€™t feel like they are cheap, just that the 1st gen's where made heavier and with moving parts. I donâ€™t have a problem with the buttons, but I did feel like the 1st Gen's volume control was nicer(for those that didn't get that model, it's volume control was the same as the Original Echo) Now I like that the 2nd gens are even more compact then the 1st Gens, and that they smoothed out a few of the edges.Conclusions:For my setup needs, I didn't need any more original Echo's, I just needed more locations to send commands to Alexa. That way we didnâ€™t have to yell or walk to a room/area Alexa was in in order for it to turn lights on or change the temperature, or turn off music. The new Echo Dots(2nd Gen) were perfect for my needs.In conclusion, if you are new to Echo, Smart Home devices, or IOT, this is the model to go with. It packs a lot of function at a very good price point. If you are a Vet of the Echo life and want to expand or complete your Echo home setup, this model is great at a price you can be proud to tell your wife about.Tips and Tricks:I was able to cover my home without having to break the bank, and if you've got someone else interested like I did, you can split a 6 pack or 12 pack and get the discount without having to buy more then you need.3rd Party Add-OnI have purchased a battery pack that attaches to the base of the Dot and allows it to work for roughly 6hours without being plugged into the wall. Perfect for when I need to move from play to place or (as I have found useful) for quiet evenings in the front porch on the swing with the wife listening to an audio book. It also make it possible to set up the device to work through your phones internet and allow it to work virtually any place your phone works(like the Echo Tap, but voice only, no need to press a button). This was definitely a cool buy. My only gripe on the several models I looked at and the one I eventually bought was that I never felt like the battery was attached securely to the Dot. It hold up to some abuse, but if dropped it will most likely disconnect and take a few minutes to set back up. In all, though, if you've got an extra Dot, this was a great addition, and honestly, I like this setup more then I like the Echo Tap. The only draw between the two is battery life and speaker volume. The Dot can connect to an external Bluetooth or AUX speaker without any issues to allow it to connect to a louder speaker if sound or quality is your issue. You can also plug the Dot with the battery into power with a micro USB. That would allow the battery to stay charged or recharge if needed without stopping the jamâ€¦or audio book in my case.Model info: Evo - an intelligent Battery Base for Amazon Echo Dot 1st & 2nd Generation ("Alexa" unlimited)https://amzn.com/B01L0XDHBOIf there is anything else you want to know or have questions about, please just let me know. Thank you for reading.~Mr Dapper

Title: Nice gadget, but can't make dinner
Body: Great way to get news, weather, music through my bluetooth speakers. She can be a little stubborn at times about shutting off and gets testy when you ask a question  she doesn't understand, but otherwise very helpful.

Title: She's Gotta An Attitide ....
Body: I like her and then I don't.  She plays music when he wants to,  Ask her a question and she does what does what she wants. Amazon needs to go back to the drawing board.  They should give her to us free.

Title: Five Stars
Body: Love this! Use in my salon to time colors, play trivia games, listen to audio books and play music. Take it home and it tells my son bedtime story's that he love because they are mine craft and undertales:)

Title: Four Stars
Body: Good when it works, a bit flaky at times and doesn't hear it's name prompt..Edit down to 2 stars after 3 months- If you want a buggy electronic device then this is the product for you.  Won't respond to prompts at times, won't follow request sometimes.  The best one was 2 days ago, "I can't find Needle and the Spoon by Lynard Skynard in your music library, here's a station you might like...Classical Jazz".  lol, Seriously????, and finally, the lights flash at times like it's responding to a request but no voice or music at all.  Sometimes unplugging it works, sometimes not.  Just got a no volume failure, completely reset it, surprise..."Now ready for setup."  Alexa, please give me a Valium for dealing with your problems.

Title: I hate.  Had it for a while.  But then one night it decided to play one band for no reason and would not stop.
Body: I hate.  Had it for a while.  But then one night it decided to play one band for no reason and would not stop.  I broke it.  I was pretty pissed that it would not stop playing no matter what I did.

Title: NOT READY FOR PRIME TIME.
Body: Great idea, but far from ready for Prime Time. It only understands about half of what I say, even when I enunciate very clearly - and it's only gotten worse with time. I wish I could recommend this product. The idea is fantastic; the execution, sadly, is not.BOTTOM LINE: If there was a way I could return this for a refund, I would. But apparently, it's too late now. A $50 lesson learned, I guess. :/

Title: App selection is good. Alexa sometimes comes on randomly when she thinks ...
Body: If you have a nearby Bluetooth speaker, the Echo Dot can connect to it and stream music fairly effortlessly. When used with Amazon Prime and my Spotify account, I have tons of music choices. App selection is good. Alexa sometimes comes on randomly when she thinks she hears her name which can be a little startling if you aren't expecting to hear someone's voice in the room while you're watching TV late at night.

Title: Loses connection
Body: Keeps losing signal, and having to reset the connection. Wonder if it's just mine, has anyone had this problem or know a fix?

Title: but it works great. i dont like the fact you cannot "sync" ...
Body: speaker is a little low even at highest level. but it works great.i dont like the fact you cannot "sync" all if you have several.....  if you are playing a song in the kitchen, it would be awesome to say play in all at same time.

Title: Four Stars
Body: When you order a white dot, you receive a black power cable.  Kind of odd and disappointing.

Title: My home is smarter... :)
Body: I am addicted to the echo system and this is my 2nd dot to go along with my Echo.  I have paired them with the TP-Link smart plug to control lights and is such a convenience.

Title: Impulse Buy
Body: Love the echo! I just wish it didn't have to be plugged in all the time! It is hard to move from room to eoom because there is a delay in setup everytime you unplug it. But it works great otherwise, "Alexa" does her best and is usually spot on!

Title: The sound is great, not nearly as booming as my original echo ...
Body: Wow, this is incredible.  The sound is great, not nearly as booming as my original echo but good enough for my bedroom.  love the size, dot just sort of hides on my dresser waiting for my commands.  If you are a prime member and don't have an echo product buy this to try it out.  We use the echo to stream music from Prime Music.  The kids have dance parties with echo.  Give one a try, you will be happy that you did.

Title: Awesome home automation tool!
Body: We multiple Echo's through our home for controlling our Lutron Caseta lights and shades via the Caseta Smart Bridge.TIP: Although the Lutron skill doesn't officially support shades you can hack it by creating scenes, which Echo will discover. You can say "Alexa, turn on <insert scene name here>". Although it sounds goofy to say "Alexa, turn on open master bedroom blinds" it does work.

Title: it's just too cool! Even if you don't connect it to an ...
Body: I can hardly believe this little DOT can bring so much pleasure! We will always keep one or two in the house. Just the ability to play almost any song or album on command is worth the money! We connected ours via blue tooth to our TV's soundbar and WOW..it's just too cool! Even if you don't connect it to an additional speaker, the sound from the DOT is enough to fill two rooms with tunes! Well worth the MONEY!

Title: I purchased 4 of these for gifts and everyone loved them including myself
Body: I purchased 4 of these for gifts and everyone loved them including myself.. Its a great size I have one on my nightstand and the other is in our tv room. I hooked up two of the wireless plugins for our lamps and Its great to just tell alexa to turn the light on or off. I need to buy another dot for our kitchen to use as a timer, recipes, music, or answer any questions I have. Really glad I purchased this item.

Title: Exceeded Expectations!
Body: Exceeded expectations, and got a great price (ordered an Alexa deal, during promotion, so got it for about $20 off of full list). I assumed it didn't play music, but it does, of course the sound is not as great as my Echo or Tap, but, it will do in a pinch. Has done everything that I've asked of it. Have it in my bedroom, quite a way from the other two (Tap I use mobile, etc., the Echo is on the ground floor).

Title: the whole family has enjoyed using Alexa - from games
Body: Coolest thing since sliced bread..... the whole family has enjoyed using Alexa - from games, the weather report, and when does the football game start type questions.... we do have some concern over the talk regarding security and the "always" listening into your home issue... will watch to see how this topic plays out.  Otherwise the dot is definitely a plus to have along with our Ecobee thermostat...

Title: Press the button so the ghosts don't come out.
Body: Love this thing. I bought a whole bunch of them. One of my family members is convinced that a dead relative is going to come out of it at night so she unplugs it. I told her to stop being ridiculous and just hit the little button on the top. This will prevent all the ghosties from coming out of it. She said she would try it but hasn't gotten back to me if the button worked. I will update as soon as I find out.

Title: A Great addition!
Body: I got one for my mom and my sister for Christmas.  My favorite features are the ability to add to my shopping list and play music.  We also get information on NFL games we like to watch.  I have an echo so I knew my family would enjoy the dot. I believe you have to have Amazon Prime for the dot to access music etc. Totally worth it!  Finally, my nieces and nephews love to hear her jokes...which makes me smile.

Title: So far so good, except...
Body: So far, I like it but I'm puzzled by something.  In the morning and getting ready for work... I want a Flash Briefing that gives me weather, my daily calendar, and the traffic to the office.  Sorry, can't.  I can get a flash briefing with weather and a bunch of useless stuff.  I then have to separately ask for traffic.  I then have to separately ask for my calendar.  Such a ridiculous oversight.ONE BIG ANNOYANCE: All Amazon Echo commercials trigger my Dots.  So far no damage but one of these days I won't be surprised if I get a bill from 1-800 Flowers or an Uber shows up.

Title: It is important that you have a seperate bluetooth speaker for best quality.
Body: We have Echo in the living room and but I spend more time in our home office.  The dot fits that requirement well because of it's size it is non intrusive to the work space.  I had a bluetooth speaker that I used for outside parties but it now is the dot speaker.  It is important that you have a seperate bluetooth speaker for best quality...the dot speaker just doesn't cut it which was expected when purchased.

Title: Only getting better as manufacturers make more skills for it.
Body: Got three of these and they work great. Right now I have them controlling lights using Wink and my nest thermostat. I also have each paired with a Bluetooth setup in each room. I might get one more for my kitchen. It's kinda nice having to turn off lights without having to get up when you're really sleepy by just saying lights off. The other good thing is this year's CES has a lot of Alexa compatible appliances.

Title: Having a great time using my echo
Body: Having a great time using my echo.  I guess I shad over-inflated expectations, so it bugse when she can't answer "who did Aaron burr fight", but I love having the alarms, timers, shopping lists and music library available without moving.

Title: I was hoping that I can get more voice command ...
Body: I was hoping that I can get more voice command, because sometimes I act something it will not respond or text a while.

Title: Great little gadget
Body: I feel that big brother Echo picks up my voice much better and sometimes it responds better too.  However, being able to connect it to the speakers is irreplaceable. Great product.. Have it hooked up to all my smart connected devices and have them controlled like this and am playing my Prime music library... I do recommend utilizing Alexa app or if you are in front of your computer have the alexa page bookmarked.

Title: So nice, we bought it twice
Body: This was Echo Dot #2 for the house- purchased just a day after receiving and setting up the first one, when we realized that we needed one upstairs in addition to downstairs.Love, Love, Love. Shopping list management. Voice control of everything (lights, TV, etc). Calendar management, Timers, Alarms, etc, etc,- all done just by speaking. I don't know how my fiancee and I lived before this product.

Title: Convenient Smart Home Device that Doesn't Break the Bank
Body: Overall the Echo Dot is pretty convenient and I was even able to set it up to deliver some medical info when prompted but it is a work in progress.  About the half the time Alexa either doesn't understand a question or tries to promote Amazon products and services instead of what I am asking for.  I hope that this will improve with time as a learn how to phrase questions and commands for the desired outcomes.

Title: All the features you know and love of Alexa
Body: All the features you know and love of Alexa, at a cheaper price!Only issues:* the sound quality (but given the price I'd say it makes sense)* if too close to your alexa, both will fire off simultaneously. Solutions:** Use the app to change one of the devices recognition word (e.g. switch from Alexa to Echo)** Whisper the one you're near!** Put them much further apart.

Title: I LOVE this gadget
Body: If I could give this 10 stars i would! I LOVE this gadget. You MUST set up with a computer, didn't set up with Android but once configured on computer  great. Easy to connect to the hub for lights and any other angst device and Bluetooth! Use it every day!!

Title: Very cool toy for anybody
Body: I love where technology is going and this is no let down. I can't get over the fact that I can call out a demand and Alexa is on it. WITH prime she automatically hooks up to your prime music which is also he greatest thing ever. She will play exact songs rather than songs like the band you like. SHe will do a lot more for me once I add he smart recepticals in my house, or ac controller etc... so cool and very affordable.

Title: Awesome
Body: Awesome product. I got it to get Alexa in the bedroom (it was so lonely before). So many uses, and new ones each week.The only thing I would improve is to put a little better speaker in it. The speaker is fine, but could be just a LITTLE bit better. I also have the original Echo and an Echo Dot. Yes, I know I can hook it to an external speaker, but if the speaker were just a wee bit better, there would be no need.

Title: We have had a lot of fun interacting with Alexa
Body: I got this on the Black Friday sale and have paired it with a Phillips Hue light set. We have had a lot of fun interacting with Alexa. I am planning to add other skills and home automation as time goes on. While it isn't perfect it is fun.

Title: fun, but the phrase recognition needs some work
Body: fun, but the phrase recognition needs some work. not as advanced as my phone as far as recognizing and intuiting.

Title: I use it almost exclusively to control smart devices, and I have only had trouble when ...
Body: I was talking to someone and said "I don't know what the weather will be like" and Alexa let me know. I use it almost exclusively to control smart devices, and I have only had trouble when I'm too far or if there is too much noise.

Title: Alex is very nice. But you must know how to program her ...
Body: Alex is very nice. But you must know how to program her and you will need plenty of G bits to run her.

Title: The absolute work product ever!!
Body: I still can't get Amazon's Alexa to play Amazon Music or Amazon Audible.  I graduated with a 4.0 from Steven's Tech with a Masters in the Management of Information Systems, still could not get this product to work.  But if you're think that it's a millennium generation thing, I had my son apply his very technical skills on this device.  He even had the patience to call Amazon tech.  All to no avail.  Perhaps I got a defective unit, but Amazon â€œhelpedâ€ just long enough for it to be too late to return this garbage and I've been an Amazon Prime Customer for many many years.  I'm so disappointed.

Body: I love this except for one thing.  I live in Arizona and it doesn't give me the option for the Arizone time zone.  I have to change back and forth between Mountain Standard Time and Pacific Standard Time when Daylight Savings Time goes on and off.

Title: AMAZON NEED TO MAKE DOT BE POWERED BY CHARGE LIKE TAP!!!
Body: I really wish that Amazon's DOT would hold a charge! You have to keep this little sucker plugged in.AMAZON can't you make this little critter hold a charge so that we can take it with us. TAP & ECHO is to big to run around with. but DOT is just the right size. I want to be able to use VOICE COMMANDS without "tapping" on it. That is why I purchased DOT; however, I didn't know that DOT couldn't hold a charge. NO Beach, hiking outdoors with this one! :-(In concusion: This is what I'd love to see...the SIZE of DOT, with the capabilities of TAP (as far as being able to charge it goes). The auto voice commands without "touching" the DOT is excellent. Because when you have sun tan lotion or sand on your hands the last thing you want to have to do is "TAP" a device's button. Additionally, when you are "outdoors" beach, park,etc. there is often not an power outlet to plug your device into. AND since none of these devices are powered by batteries that mean that they would have to be "charged" prior to going to the beach, park, or something.DOTS sound is lower than the others because it's smaller. No problem I can just hook speakers to it like suggested; however, we really DESIRE for DOT to hold a charge like TAP!!!

Title: Every home should have one
Body: I am so very glad that we bought echo dot.  I have been wanting one of these since they came out.  The set up was extremely easy and we were so impressed that we purchased a second one to put in our business.  It works so great for so many reasons.  At the business my wife uses it to check the weather, the news, use it's timers, set appointments, right things on the calendar, and much much more including music.

Title: Feel Like Jean-Luc Picard
Body: Wow.  Love this thing.  I'm not a techie, but set-up was easy and I already had Music Unlimited added to my Prime Music.  Hooked it up to my big-rig stereo.  Love the news flash, and weather.  Very handy shopping list and calendar.  Easy timer and alarm.  Plan to add climate control and lighting eventually.  Plus it's just way cool;  feel like Jean-Luc Picard saying "Alexa" instead of "Computer."

Body: Love it. I played pro football therfore I have 13 concussions. . This thigh reminds me of dr appts, the wather, changes the channels on the tv.. finds movies and tells me what channel there on. Get the " how to work echo"  BUY IT.

Body: I use the Echo daily. I have 1 in each room. Great product, really compliments my smart home devices.

Title: Another great device from Amazon. I want one in every room.

The update that allows only one Alexa to respond is the best thing! I don't have to worry about two or three responses. The 3.5 jack is also a great thing to have. I plug it into my receiver or a portable speaker I leave on all the time.

Body: I have used the Echo Dot to control lights, as well as stream music, and get news updates. It works well, We have had issues with it understanding us on occasion so I have been experimenting with placement. I look forward to its continued development. We have it connected to our sound bar in the living room and see it as part of the house now. I wish that we had the ability to create our own wake-up word for it though.

A lot of the apps it can learn are kind of useless and better executed by other means. I use it to order common items sometimes and that doesn't seem to work, it's easier to just use my phone. It's an alluring product, but it's just not there yet.

Title: Underwhelming, but works okay, I guess

To be clear: an entirely voice-based interface is really cool!Overall, the product experience is underwhelming and the capabilities of the echo are mediocre.Take this with a grain of salt knowing that it's only the 2nd version of a new kind of technology, and I have very high expectations.

Title: Five Stars

Title: So much better than Siri at understanding - I use it to ...
Body: So much better than Siri at understanding - I use  it to play music on Spotify, set alarms and sleep timers, and also use it to control my TV lights and thermostat.

Title: Alexa is my new best friend!
Body: Alexa, what's the weather!  Alexa, tell me todays news! Alexa, let the dog out!  ... er.. two out of three ain't bad!  My son says I need a "smart door", I said I need a smarter dog.  But I digress.  I love love love this little hockey puck, er, Echo Dot.I first started using Alexa with the Fire TV box, but there are some things not programmed in it that I wanted, most notably alarms and timers.  I also decided that having to turn on the speaker then hold the button on the remote was too inconvenient, so I purchased the Echo Dot.  I am very very pleased with it overall, and love trying out new things to request of Alexa.  I will confess the two primary reasons I got it were: 1) to ask for time, weather, and news without ever moving in bed when I wake, not even opening my eyes, and 2) for playing music, especially at night, but anytime.  It is the feature I love most on the Fire TV Alexa, and it's even more convenient with the Dot.  I can say "Alexa, play soothing music"; "Alexa, play Neon Steeple album by Crowder"; "Alexa, play Fionuoula Sherry"; "Alexa, play classic rock"; "Alexa, play The River by Dan Fogelberg" and she does.  She learns what I like and will play music similar to that for requests like "play soft music".  I love that I can have a song on my mind and just ask Alexa to play it, so I can listen.  This is easily my favorite feature of Alexa-enabled devices.I have the white Dot, because I didn't want to wait two weeks for the black one to be in stock, and the white is very nice, glossy, and I am quite pleased to have it instead of the black, esp where I put it on my nightstand, the other items are all white as well.  There is a soft grip on the bottom to prevent it from sliding around.I am intrigued by the possibilities of controlling a "smart home", and if I had my own home, I would be adding smart devices.  However, the home I live in is definitely not "smart", and the people I live with are not interested in making it so.  So that is one area of Alexa's skills I likely won't try out much, though I may add a smart bulb/hub for my room eventually.Alexa operates off of pre-programmed "skills" (like, to ask for weather, or news, or time) and besides the ones that come already enabled, there are hundreds (thousands?) more available.  My 11 yr old grandson comes in my room for jokes and random facts, and on occassion to do homework (oops!).  There are skills to enable for most any desire or need, and more being added daily.  Strange as it may sound, I can see Alexa even being a boost to people, especially disabled and seniors, something to interact with when no people are around.  Sad fact of our world, but true.I dropped one star for a couple of issues.  1) On occassion Alexa said she had a connection problem, but when I asked her if she was connected, she said she was connected to the internet.  2) Alexa wakes easily to her name, whether from down the hall or next to the Dot.  However, while it seems she can hear a command even over other noise from down the hall, sometimes there are problems with her understanding and responding to a command over background noise when I am right next to the Dot.  It's a wierd issue that baffles me. 3) When Alexa is playing music, even from a bluetooth speaker several feet away that isn't loud, she does not wake.Overall, I am extremely satsified with the Echo Dot, and may give a few for Christmas gifts.  I am looking forward to see what improvements and new things are enabled through updates in the future.

Title: Works Great With Hue Bulbs

Looking forward to getting a harmony hub to control my TV! It's a great alarm clock, updates you on your commute, and gives you updates in the news and sports. Very functional, and it's only a small little circle.

Title: We agree, awesome product
Body: Like almost everyone else, we love these things. We have two dots, and one full sized Echo. I actually like the dot's better, because they seem to process the commands faster, and without a delay.The one thing I wish for, is being able to give the system the name I choose (not just amazon's three choices). The wife really wants to re-name it "computer". No, she's not a trekkie...LOL

Title: Alexa Rocks!
Body: Alexa is fun. Connected to Bluetooth radio speakers very easily. I share my Amazon Prime with my son so I don't get to use all the features and have to use Pandora for my music but I am very happy. She has a daily greeting with what happened on this day in a particular year. Weather from local station and on an on. I am very happy with my purchase and use my Echo Dot daily. Speedy delivery and easy set up.

Title: Great product overall..
Body: This is over all a good product. The speakers is pretty loud for such a small device, the price is great and Alexa works well with the amazon prime membership. The biggest problem is Alexa doesn't always render the correct results based on what I say.

Title: I'm disappointed in this
Body: I'm disappointed in this, I had high hopes.  But it does not even get the basic weather correctly then why should I trust anything else it says.  I asked for local weather, it said 7 below but my phone and radio said it s 21 degrees.  I have a daughter who lives in maui Hawaii, when I asked what weather was like over there it said its 18 degrees, really??? This is basic information, not happy right now.

Title: Reliable and good quality device for home
Body: I own two Echos already, but I had to buy two more of these to bring entertainment and information to my daughter's room and my home office.  These are very easy to setup, the sound quality is good for it's size, and it fits neatly with the dÃ©cor of the room.  The microphone is sensitive enough to pickup voices far away and accurately.  It has been easy to connect these to Bluetooth speakers in each room.

Body: Got for my son for his bedroom so he could listen to music.  Our whole family loves Alexa and the dot was a perfect companion to have in a smaller room.  I love it's size and it's speaker was better than I expected.  Set up was easy.

Title: Three Echos and Counting

Title: Still preferred over Google Home
Body: Between Alexa and Google home, this has better app development, a more robust command support and overall generally strong support of 3rd party integration.  You can ask basically the same as googles unit, plus some.  The pick up is excellent, I do have to yell if I'm 2 rooms away but thats expected.  I use one downstairs, one in the bedroom and the two units work very well together without double pickup.

Title: Glad I purchased!
Body: Makes doing simple tasks even easier and faster!  Alexa (the on-board voice assistant) can do a variety of things, such as look up something on Wikipedia, tell you the news and weather, tell you a joke and even control smart home devices around your house such as thermostats, locks and lights.  Alexa is a bit quirky and might not be able to do very specific tasks but with each update it learns how to do more tasks.

Title: Automation linked (with video), stereo sounds nice
Body: I have a Wink controller, and have been adding home automation here and there around the house. I live in a three story home, and have added Dots to each level.Amazon Dots were easy to sync to my wireless and I linked them into my Wink account (or Wink was linked to Amazon app).  I have had no problem in setup, nor does Alexa have difficulty in hearing me.  In fact, when reviewing the video I just created off of my phone, Alexa started to respond to the video audio!On the top floor, I have the Dot as a stand alone and use it for an alarm clock, verbal bedroom thermostat (Nest) adjuster, and 'weather station'. I bicycle commute to work most days, and it is nice to know what to expect outside when I am getting up and getting prepped (ie warmer cycling clothing or cooler needed?).The downstairs Dot is in my office and currently is only answering questions and changing the second floor thermostat which impact temperature on the lower level.The second floor / living room Dot is connected to my Marantz stereo receiver (Monster 3.5mm to RCA cable).  My receiver is not wireless nor does it have Bluetooth. The Dot plays music through my receiver with decent/good sound quality. It also can turn on and off an automated outlet that is connecting a lamp in the living room.The Dots do not currently see nor control my automated front door lock or garage door, though Wink does.I have uploaded a short video that shows some of the automation in my living room being controlled by Alexa and Wink.  Sound quality in this video is not that decent; it was captured off my phone.  Don't mind the mini-tour, or my fur-balls.  I did not mention this in the video, but I can either ask Alexa to up the volume from the Dot's end, or I can manually change it from my receiver's controller.Let me know in the comments if you have any questions.

Title: This is my only disappointment. Other than that
Body: I would give it 5 stars but often I get the "I can't access your ### account right now".  Substitute ### with "music" or "news".  This is my only disappointment.  Other than that, very satisfied.  I hope Amazon will work on the servers to make all services always accessible.  Typically mornings and evenings are worst for service disruptions (when I use the services the most).

Title: Not sure I could love this little thing any more
Body: Not sure I could love this little thing any more.  So much fun, I have hooked lights up to it with Wi-Fi plugs and nice to walk into rooms not being dark and out of rooms with a simple voice command.  So many features to name.  I love the timer, news flash, the weather, playing whatever kind of music I like.  Everyone should have at least one of these.  We have 5 for the house.  Feels so Jetsonish!!

Title: Awesome Alexa:)
Body: originally i wanted the Amazon  Echo tower but at almost $200 bucks I kept on thinking about it, until the Dot went on sale for $39 and I ordered it right away. Best decision ever! I love Alexa, she keeps me entertained with snappy comebacks,  unusual facts and when i need the essentials, weather, music, homework help she's always ready. sometimes she falters but it's not often. i highly recommend!!

Title: Needs more
Body: A little disappointed. I was hoping Alexa would work with Pandora and Sonos speakers. I found out that she cannot control Sonos yet and may be able to later this year. She is so-so on answering questions. You have to download a skill set for her to tell you things. Definitions and weather, yes. Math problems yes. However she cannot look things up like Google can. I am hoping the technology improves.

Title: Playing Cool Jazz Melodies on Spotify"
Body: Got this as a gift. When it comes to playing music (basically the only reason I even use it) it seriously lacks in the voice commands. I threw it in a drawer after briefly fantasizing about Gonk spiking this paper weight. I will go back to simply using my phone as a controller to avoid yelling at Alexa: " Play Hour by Hour Playlist......Playing Cool Jazz Melodies on Spotify".... Amazon Fail.

Title: Very Disappointed !
Body: Very disappointed. I had great expectations for this device, as i was going to base my whole home automation on several of these devices however the following issues forced my to return it:1. Horrible Mic pick up. This is suppose to be the strong point of this device. Audio recognition for several people in my household was horrible. At 10 feet it was non existent. in other words, Echo would not even respond. Even after several session of "voice training", it still was terrible.2. Home automation linking with other devices has alot of "growing up" to do. The application on echo as well as the various drivers are very immature. I had difficulty pairing up to Z wave devices even though i was using a smart things hub (which is whole another disaster ...). very frustrating and unrewarding experience.3. Constant drop outs. Echo would loose internet connection when no issues existed. Mysteriously, echo would periodically loose internet connection and have to either be manually re-booted and initialize on it one. Very annoying !4. Alexa would start talking on her own, un-commanded. seems that she would repeat the last flash news or last music she was performing before being told to stop. then within an hour or so she would start up on her own.Please note that i have a 50 MB Fiber optic Internet service and run dual routers with 2.4 and 5 Ghz coverage in my house.I really wanted to like this device and build up my home automation. Both where a disappointment ! It seems that this device was not ready fro prime time. I will be looking to see of Google Home or Apple Home will be any better.

Title: It's awesome when it works, but not ready for prime time yet.
Body: I got this as part of a bundle deal with the Harmony remote. At first, it was pretty cool. I'm not like a seasoned user of the echo though. I didn't even know if I had a use for it, and forced myself to try to use it until it just became a habit. I had it paired up with the Harmony hub. It can only do basic things like turn on/off things and that's about it. Yes you can change channels with it, but you can't do something as simple as like pausing and stuff like that which would have been way more useful for me than changing the channels. When it works, it works great. I don't have any problems with it at it's best. But there were a couple of seething issues that they need to address, and one minor one.First, the wifi connection. This thing keeps losing connection somehow. Mines placed like 8ft away from the router and it constantly loses connection.  I have no idea how. So you have to go through the setup again. The setup sucks too, because you can't even update the Wi-Fi on the Alexa app. It always shows a blank screen. So you gotta go on your laptop to alexa.amazon.com and do it that way. At first, it dropped the connection like once every like 4 days. then it just started doing it all the time. I used to just disconnect the power and reconnect it and it would pick it up on it's own. But after awhile, that doesn't do anything. In the time that it takes to setup, I would have been finished with that I wanted it to do already. Oh yeah, the other thing about losing the Wi-Fi with the Harmony hub. You have to tell it to rediscover the devices which take like 5 mins so that it can control the hub. That's the main thing that made me fed up and I returned it.Second, the microphone issue. As with everyone, it sucks. At first, it works really well picking up like 99% of what I say. Then slowly it picks up less and less. I think I was at like 40% by the time I decided to return it. I don't know what's wrong with it. I already did the voice training and everything and the first couple of days that thing was like spot on. Couple that with the Wi-Fi disconnect, it's like first it doesn't hear you, then when it does, it's like well too bad, I'm not connected to the internet to do anything. WTF, useless.The other minor thing is the Alexa app. You can't even set up the Wi-Fi the first time because it just does the blank screen thing. If I didn't go online and search for a workaround. I would have just returned it right away. Fix your app Amazon. The only reason why I consider it minor is because you could do the setup still with your laptop.Also with the 3.5mm jack. I haven't seen anyone post this issue, but on mines. Whenever I turn off the speaker that it's connected to without taking the cable out, it stills try to send audio to it as if it were still on. So hooking it up to my amp was pointless because when the amp is off, you can't hear Alexa. I'm not going to leave it on all the time. This happens with like portable speakers and stuff too. I'm not about to disconnect the cable every time. I ended up just using alexa to turn on my amp through the Harmony hub to play music instead.All in all, it's an okay device. I would pick it up again if they could iron out those issues. I feel like the it's like kind of software glitch or something that is going since it works really well in the beginning and then it slows down over time and these issues crop up. It is constantly uploading data though from what I could see on my router. I don't know what it's uploading though.

Title: Amazing how much these can do once you get them set up
Body: Best stocking stuffer.  We ended up with an Echo and 3 dots for Christmas.  Put one in each bedroom and my boys are loving them - from having it read stories, to play music to turn off the lights (we have HUE hub).  After just a week, we find ourselves really using this thing which I had bought more as a 'toy'.  Have ordered pizza, refilled some Amazon orders and still learning all it can do.

Title: Great little virtual helper
Body: Life changer (for my son). He's addicted to his Alexa (will tell his Alexa to turn off his can lights even when the switch is right at hand) and we may end up adding more to our home in the future. Great speech recognition and works with other IOT systems in our house, like SmartThings and Nest. Pretty happy and the price was pretty good, though I'm a little concerned by the privacy issues...

Title: Prefer the Echo
Body: It is the size of a hockey puck, so the speakers are not big (not great sound quality). I would suggest using the Bluetooth to connect to another speaker, but if you plan to do that then just pay the extra money for the echo instead of the dot. It's worth it trust me. If you want something smaller and convenient then settle for the dot. We have both and personally I like the echo much better.

Title: Not as good as the First Gen
Body: I have the original Alexa about $179. and 2 Dots for which I paid about $80. each, I just bought the Echo Dot 2nd Gen I don't think this unit works as well as the first gen, it doesn't respond as well or as fast when playing music I almost have to shout out the commands to "stop" "pause" also problems with events alarms and so on not so with the first gen. Good thing thay dropped the price.

Title: I expected the speaker to be pretty limited, but it's much quieter than I had ...
Body: I was so excited to receive my Echo Dot, but a few weeks later and I'm feeling underwhelmed. I expected the speaker to be pretty limited, but it's much quieter than I had anticipated.  Also, it seems Alexa can only process very simple requests- not really what I expected given the advertisements. Overall, I wish I had saved up and to buy a more expensive but better version of this system.

Title: Excellent investment
Body: How much fun and how informative this little "Dot" can be.  Doesn't take up much room at all.  I can get the latest weather forecast without having  to go to my phone or computer.....just simply ask Alexa "what is the temperature in ______?" Within seconds I know what to wear and what coat I need to wear, etc.  Great little item for not a lot of money, i.e., good investment!

Title: Alexa in a smaller more portable version
Body: Works really well with my Bose Soundlink Mobile II (older model) which makes it sound much better than just the regular Echo speaker which I have as well.  I just wish my Bose Soundlink wouldn't time out and disconnect from the Echo Dot after idle time.  No complaints...its Alexa in a smaller form factor.  I've even taken it on business trips to use it in my hotel room...works like a champ.

Title: Now Alexa in every room, outstanding and a great price!

Title: Can't link to iPhone calendar! :-(
Body: I would have given this five stars, but am so very disappointed that it can't be linked to my i-calendar.  I use all Apple products and don't want to start another calendar.  One of the main reasons I got Alexa was so she could keep me on track with my calendar. Other than that, I am very pleased with the product. Setup is extremely easy and I am amazed at all she can do!

Title: Lil echo dot
Body: I love this lil guy. The sound is great, and I can take it anywhere in the house with easy transport. Love it

Title: This thing is awesome, I love using it for music
Body: This thing is awesome, I love using it for music. I connected mine to some Pyle speakers that have an aux input and plug into the wall.  They stay on at all time so my dot/speaker combo is always ready to output good music.

Title: Love it.
Body: We have the larger echo but bought this for my "She Shack". Love it.

Title: I hardly use it. I can ask my smartphone ...
Body: I hardly use it.  I can ask my smartphone same questions.  Most of the time  Echo says it doesn't understand.  I did not return it.  May give it to my grandchilden.

Title: Five Stars
Body: Great device, will definitely be buying another one later this year as gifts.

Title: Alexa!! Write a review :)
Body: Handy..easy to handle. Loved this product. I can play bay areas FM (Bollywood Songs) as well but we need to connect through app,  cause Alexa does not recognize the FM stations sometimes.I have connected it with my Bluetooth sound bar.Hope Amazon brings some features which enables us to ask any question to Alexa like google.

Title: This is a really cool device to have
Body: This is a really cool device to have. I wasn't sure if it would be very useful at first, but I actually like it a lot and it's nice to have around. My only complaint is that it is a bit tricky to set up to WiFi and it doesn't always understand the questions/commands. It's still a relatively new system, but it's supposed to automatically update and learn or adapt to you the more you use it.

Title: Love this little wonder!
Body: Can say enough about this little wonder. I already had the house setup with WeMo switches and now I can talk tell Alexa to turn things on and not have to use the app all the time; though I still do use the app and timer feature in the WeMo app. Getting the echo dot to see the WeMo devices was simple and I haven't see any issues yet.Looking at picking up the full size echo next!

Title: Best smart home device there is.
Body: I love my new Echo Dot. Great way to start your smart home project. We have fun with our 2 echos traing it, getting our daily briefing for the day, traffic, weather,etc, etc, etc. I started with one Echo Dot, loved it so much, I purchased another as well as 2 switches, and to smart bulbs. I don't see the Alexa system going away soon. IMO, it's the best and right choice for home automation.

Title: So my friends at the CIA can help destroy ISIS!
Body: Cool gadget but paranoid now that I know the CIA can spy on me with this device.

Title: Works great but the speaker quality is not that great
Body: Works great but the speaker quality is not that great, highly recommend getting a bluetooth or wired speaker to go with it.

Title: Junk
Body: Worked ok about two months. Never responded well to voice commands. Totally shuts down now on many commands. Not worth $40.

Title: MUST NEED PRODUCT!!!
Body: This thing is amazing. I ask it questions to help with my homework, listen to music on the radio stations, ask it what the weather is like in the mornings. This thing is incredible! Best $50 I have ever spent on anything. The actual speaker portion isn't the best but I plugged it into the speakers on my desktop and it sounds amazing. 10/10 would purchase for a friend or family member for a gift.

Title: It is annoying to have to repeat or get right on top ...
Body: Bought refurnbished item. It is not working well. It loses the connection often and doesn't respond to request frequently. It is annoying to have to repeat or get right on top of it to get it to respond. https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01DFKC2SO/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_0

Title: I own the Echo and got the dot to extend ...
Body: I own the Echo and got the dot to extend those capabilities into another room. However, I've had nothing but problems with the new unit. The Echo effortlessly understands most of what I ask, but the Dot seems to frequently not hear me, misunderstand my statements, or fail to return accurate information.  Moreover, the dot has turned on by itself multiple times.  This seems to relate to the dot bluetooth connection to being connected and disconnected from a bose sound link mini speaker.  All in all, I expect I will be returning this product.

Title: Five Stars
Body: Almost as good as big sister Echo.  Just need to connect quality blue tooth speakers

Title: Sorry you don't work so well.
Body: Â Only nice when it works; "I'm sorry, I'm having trouble understanding right now, please try again a little later" quickly becomes a tiresome response to the voice prompt.

Title: Great gadget
Body: I bought this for my husband but I use it more than him.  I love that I can just ask Alexa to play songs from a certain artist and she does.  The speaker is not the greatest for music but that is easily fix by plugging it in to another speaker.  The one complaint we have is you have to have it plugged in for it to work.  So if you want to move it around you have to take the cord with you.

Title: So far I've enjoyed my dot
Body: So far I've enjoyed my dot. Purchased a set of speakers to go with it and they sounded horrible. Alexa on her own sounded just fine, albeit a little less loud. Returning the speakers for a different set. I think she should be able to answer more questions than she does but other than that the dot is great for what I got it for: playing music while I work! Looking forward to using it more.

Title: If it worked with Google it would be much better.
Body: Oh they are getting close. I know the tech law says wait for version 3 before buying but this was just too appealing to resist especially at the pre Christmas price of $39. If it worked with Google it would be much better.

Title: It does what we need it to do which is ...
Body: It does what we need it to do which is playing music,  and although i think it has a lot of potential it still would benefit for some improvements, the interface leaves a lot to be desired, and it's is in need of more apps

Title: A great value for "Alexa" fans.
Body: All the features of the full size Amazon Echo, except for the absence of the better speaker system in the full-size unit, at a very reasonable price.  And the small speaker in the unit is quite adequate for purposes other than listening to full-range music, such as you "conversations" with Alexa, listening to news casts in you "flash briefing," listening to low level background music, etc.

Title: Five Stars
Body: I have the Echo and everyone was saying the Dot sound is tinny!  Not at all!

Title: Please allow for use outside of Amazon approved locations
Body: It's a fun toy, but so far I haven't found it to be very useful, although I guess I don't live in an Amazon approved country, so a lot of things simply don't work.Please Amazon, at least allow us to set the proper location so we can get weather information etc.

Title: Great first AI steps but needs improvements overall
Body: UPDATE:  Well I have had my Dot for nearly 3 months now and I've had to give it a 1 star from previous 4 stars. My reasoning for this is simple. Alexa rarely has answers to a multitude of questions you may ask jus in daily life. She almost never hears you unless you speak overly loud and precisely. She responds to way too much stuff from things on tv ( like Commercials for Alexa/Echo or just random dialog). You'll be sitting there and she spouts off things without even being asked. Lastly, Amazon customer service on Alexa is pathetic. All you get is a lame apology and thank you for your feedback. It seems they have ZERO intention on actually making Alexa work better, just adding more useless skills. I feel there is an engineering defect since numerous reports show she does hear. So the 7 microphones are basically useless. If I could return my dot, I would. My experience has been even worse then Apples Siri, and that right there says a lot.I love interacting with Alexa. She has some issues with understanding, doesn't quite hear over normal everyday background sounds, and she has a very complicated interface. You should not have to ask Alexa to open an app first then ask her to look up the info. If amazon want a true AI experience, they need to stop with the myriad of apps and just let people ask a question. ( i.e., you have to say ' Alexa ask good housekeeping what's the best way to remove a stain.' It should just be ' Alexa how do you remove a stain '. No asking for an app, there are too many and no one can remember every app and what it does ).I have installed wemo and caseta switchs and plugs through my house and for the most part it works very very well. Just be care in naming each device something that is easily understood and not confused by another work. I found that if I name a light ' living room' and then ask Alexa to turn living room lights on, she will often say she has found several lights and I need to specify which one. So I named it just living room, leaving off 'light'. So I'll say Alexa, living room on. And she understands better.

Title: Entertainment center in the bathroom
Body: Great improvement over first generation. The microphone is much better at picking up commands in a noisy environment (running water in bathroom). I installed this in the wall of the bathroom, connected to a Polk Audio RC6s In-Ceiling Stereo Speaker (Single, White) and Pyle Home PCA2 2X40-Watt Stereo Mini Power Amplifier (located in a utility closet behind the bathroom). I cut a whole the size of the Dot in a 5" WHITE Door Stop Wall Protector, Knob/Handle Guard to frame the Dot in the wall cutout. The whold thing works great.

Wish it could get a bit better Audio but this isn't th higher end version so what are you going to do. Overall can't complain. Just buy it!

I have read every piece of info on the Alexa app and Amazon.com site and nothing helps the device. I am either going to return it, although I'm sure I will lose my money. but the item just doesn't work. I am so stinking disappointed with your product Amazon!

Title: Need a update.
Body: I received 4 Echo Dots for Christmas. We have them set up around the house. (living room, bedroom, office, etc) Everything is working perfectly. My only complaint is that I cannot set up my Surface Pro 4 to the Alexa App. I get a message that it's not compatible with the Surface Pro. Other than that, they work, even though I have to use my 3 year old iPad. So Amazon, how about a update.

Title: We love Alexa
Body: What fun!  Not being an Apple fanboy, I'm delighted with Alexa and she seems at least equal to Siri in her abilities and in some ways superior, based on what I'e seen friends achieve with Siri.  Can't wait for my grandkids to meet Alexa and looking forward to her ever expanding repertoire of skills.  No idea what, if any, advantage the larger units have.  The Echo Dot seems ideal to me.

Title: Worth the money
Body: She is super smart.  Not sure what the differences in the different models, but this Dot does everything I need.  It plays music.  It has to always be plugged in, though.  It is the same size as a bluetooth speaker I have, so I quicky realize she cannot be unplugged.  Kids keep playing the song "Rub Some Bacon On It".  I wish I could tell her to not listen to anyone else but me.

Title: and love it. The idea that I get the same ...
Body: Cant imageine why anyone would buy the original Echo with this available.  I bought the Echo on presale for $99, and love it.  The idea that I get the same functionality from the Dot for less than half that is amazing.  It is perfect out of the box for an office, bathroom, or kitchen.  Just hook it into your home stereo or to a Bluetooth speaker if you need to really fill the house with sound.

Title: Five Stars
Body: Love these little fellows and now have four of them.  One in each bedroom.

Title: Great extension for Alexa
Body: Our son gave us Alexa last Christmas. We bought the dot to keep in bedroom because I always think of something I need to do or something I need to add to grocery list. My husband loves that in the middle of the night. Now I need one for office. The dot is not made for great music unless you hook it up to a bluetooth speaker but she reads my books loud enough for me to hear her at night.

Title: The sound quality if very good! For the price
Body: My husband bought the Amazon Echo for me for Christmas, so, I did him a favor and bought the Echo Dot.  The sound quality if very good!  For the price, you just can't beat it.

Body: I have it connected to my wave radio so it sounds even better than the original Echo.

Title: can I get the discount please.
Body: My problem is the price dropped a few days after I bought it.The product itself is just awesome. Ask dot to questions play jeopardy or quiz games etc. Etc. Lots and lots of fun to keep the whole family happy.

Title: Awesome. Controlling my Nest
Body: Awesome. Controlling my Nest, Philips Vue lights, and soon my Sonos. Cheap. Put one in kitchen to help with recipes, read you a story to kill time, or set timers. Other in bedroom to turn off all light when going to bed.

Title: Easy to use and very helpful
Body: Love Alexa!  I don't think we have even scratched the surface of what she can do. The shopping list and to do list are great. So easy to keep track of what you need and need to do. We use the timer a lot too, very handy.

Title: A decent buy for the price. Add your own speaker for quality music.
Body: It is an economical version if you don't need a fancy speaker built in. The description made it sound like you needed an external speaker for music, but while a larger speaker is needed for quality sound, the built-in speaker is fine for just background sound. I wasn't impressed with how Alexa selected music from Amazon Prime, but it was much better after I switched the default to Spotify.

Title: Great for kids too!!
Body: Love mine! Have one in most rooms. Bought some for my grandkids. They have so much fun with them and their TP-link light switches and plugs that they never leave their lights or devices on anymore!!

Title: Four Stars
Body: bought as a gift and they loved it keeps telling me every time I see them

Title: Not worth it unless used in a small room or office.
Body: I have the full size echo. This one isn't nearly loud enough. I could barely hear it over the shower. And they want you to spend even more money on another device to have unlimited music. It's like paying for another subscription. Not worth it.

Title: BUYER BEWARE!
Body: BUYER BEWARE! This item is now listed as nonreturnable.

Title: One Star
Body: Nope.

Title: Only good for doing things around the house
Body: Only good for doing things around the house, like turning on lights and stuff. She's annoying like any other women.

Title: One Star
Body: worthless

Title: One Star
Body: Wish i had never bought it.

Title: Very difficult to get things like updates to Hue or Harmony One to be available ...
Body: Still needs some work, doesn't always have an answer and when it doesn't it sends a link to a Bing search to my tablet... Bing? really? Adding "skills" to Alexa is simple to do the first time, making changes to them afterwards however, that is a pain.  Very difficult to get things like updates to Hue or Harmony One to be available to Alexa afterwards.Being able to turn on/off lights, and turn on/off my home theater and changing channels by voice is VERY COOL!Would be nice if the Echo could hand-off things to my Fire TV though.

Title: Goodbye Privacy... You have none now
Body: With all sorts of advancement in technology and the new laws being written to invade your privacy by any means necessary at all times and certainly at all times you can be monitored because this device is connected to the internet and with a microphone enabled anybody can be listening EG. Hackers

Title: Loving' My Dot!
Body: I love the convenience of my Dot! It is small and easily portable and the sound is just as good in my opinion as the Echo (which I have 2 of - my house is large and spread out). I decided to get the smaller Dot for my office so it would take up less space. I do find I have to speak louder to it than I do to my Echo's, which I don't necessarily like. I will try moving it and see if that helps. I did also have to rename it so that my other devices didn't all come on as well.  These are a great product, you can listen to music, the news, a book, have it tell you jokes, the weather, find out when football games are playing and who your favorite team is playing against and where, have it play a game with you, like trivia, etc the list goes on.  It is always getting smarter so who knows by the end of next year what she can do! You do have to have the internet to use thisI also bought a separate case for less than $5 to store it in if I want to take it with me somewhere, for example on a trip or to a friends house, so I don't just have to toss it in my purse.

Title: Three Stars
Body: beats me.. sold it same day... not having big brother record my life.. bundle made me get it

Title: I love you. Yes
Body: OMG. Where do I start? Alexa, Alexa, Alexa, I love you. Yes, I've actually said that to her before and she told me that was very nice of me to say. I bought the Phillips Hue first generation light bulb starter kit with two bulbs. I was elated at how easy it was to get everything connected. I also purchased two Wemo smart plugs and plugged my Christmas lights into it. After pairing one of them with Alexa I just say, "Alexa, turn on Christmas lights." And walla..... My Christmas lights come on. No more bending in awkward positions behind the tree to p,up them in. Alexa also turns on my electric blanket a half hour before I go to bed with a simple voice command. She tells me the forecast, the date, a couple really bad jokes, but cute. I just reviewed the app site where I can download more features into her. You will not regret this purchase. If you are on the fence about it, just pull the pin, you will be happy you did!!

Title: Second Gen, Amazon Echo Dot
Body: I love this little "Hockey Puck"! The price is right and, since I purchased a Wink Hub 2, it does what it's supposed to do. The only problem I have with this one Amazon Echo Dot, I don't have two Amazon Echo Dots!

Title: Five Stars
Body: Always a good purchase. Does everything the echo does and it made a great gift

Title: The speaker is like a clock radio
Body: Had to name it "Echo" as Alexis kept picking up down in the living room. Once I did that I've had no issues. The speaker is like a clock radio, not the greatest, but just fine if you want quiet background music. Don't think you have to buy a Bluetooth speaker just to hear anything other than her voice. Will be buying more for other rooms! Can't wait to see what all Echo becomes in the future.

Title: The Jarvis of today
Body: Alexa is super useful from setting reminders, quick facts, turning on/off lights and much more.  We have it in the kitchen and is great to control virtually everything. cooking timers and so forth alloying us to multi-task.

Title: it is what it is
Body: the dot is ok. the sound quality is not nearly as good as the echo which i knew going into it but i just don't think it gets loud enough. i also wish it worked more with the echo they work as two separate unites. I thought i would be able to tell one something and they both would do it. for what it is  it works well but i think it might be more worth it to get a tap instead of the dot

Title: We expanded our home automation cheaply with this.
Body: We liked the first Echo Dot so much that we bought a second one for the bedroom, and immediately became addicted to listening to music to go to sleep.  This one also controls a bedroom lamp (through a Belkin bluetooth switch).  Works great, and we enjoy being able to set a timer to stop bedtime music after a time we choose and turning on and off the lamp just by asking Alexa to do it.

Title: Superb quality
Body: Love it! The only thing, that does what I tell it to, in our house. My 5 year old, loves to ask her the weather. My three year old love to ask her to sing and tell jokes. My wife and I love asking her to play music and the news. Our family loves her! My  5 year old said she need to be in next years Christmas picture because she is part of the family now.get one you will love it!

Title: but would like to see it go a lot farther
Body: So far its promising, but would like to see it go a lot farther. Custom names would be nice, but more importantly, I would really like the ability to custom control commands. For instance, I was able to connect this to my harmony remote and can now turn on my tv by telling echo to turn on the tv, however adjusting volume requires me to tell echo to "turn on turn up the volume"

Title: Good but could use some improvements still.
Body: Still waiting for the actual search results like Google home has.  The skills are nice but it's more that you have to remember to use the skills, if you don't word the question for the skills exactly right then the skill doesn't trigger.  Got 2 WeMO outlets to work with Alexa and they have been working well, except sometimes Alexa says they aren't responding (even if they do respond).

Title: The echo is pretty good. However it doesn't know some easy answers ...
